title: I cannot manage to get FireFox screen to show  the 4/5 options in the upper LH corner, to help  me get FireFox as my search engine>>>.
content:
I have been successfully using FireFox for many years, recently we downsized into a Condo,now 81 years young. I have FireFox as my default browser choice, but it only lists Google on the search bar, when I type in my search in the box under the Firefox name it immediately jumps up to the top of the page Google browser.

How do I get back my screen to use FireFox as my search engine ?? I have tried to change it but will only give me two options Google or Google ?? Is it possible to go back to the screen and try and start again??

Many thanks to anyone who will give me info as to how to rectify my problem, be gentle with me as I am efficient in using the computer but less so trying to solve my problems. Robin

title: Prijava na eportal z digitalnim potrdilom
content:
Po prijavi na spletno stran (npr. edavki, ebanka ipd.) z digitalnim potrdilom, se ne morem na isti portal prijaviti z drugim potrdilom. Tega ne morem storiti niti po brisanju piškotkov niti ponovnem zagonu Firefoxa. Vedno pride do samodejnega izbora digitalnega potrdila in prijave s tem potrdilom. Težava se pojavlja na večih računalnikih (namizni, prenosni) z windows 10 in windows 11. Prosim za namig, kaj storiti.

After registering on a website (eg e-taxes, e-bank, etc.) with a digital certificate, I cannot log in to the same portal with another certificate. I can't do this after deleting cookies or restarting Firefox. There is always an automatic selection of the digital certificate and login with this certificate. The problem occurs on multiple computers (desktop, laptop) with windows 10 and windows 11. Please give me a hint of what to do.
creator: franc.kosicek

title: Primary password prompt not on Firefox startup
content:
Hello everyone, When starting up Firefox v100 on OSX, two "password required" windows open immediately in a row to ask for my primary password. I type my password in the prompt window on top (appearing last) which works fine and closes. Then the second window (which appeared first) gets behind the firefox main window and I can't neither access the password prompt window nor use the main window. The problem started today after the firefox update on this computer and remains the same if I try to restart Firefox. I had a similar issue on a different computer but it was not systematic and restarting Firefox would be enough to fix the problem.

Please any help ? (I can't share troubleshooting information as I cant click in the window to export it.

title: Loosing pinned tabs
content: When you have a number of pinned tabs that you want to stay and during a session a blank window opens behind your current active session (or you open one for some reason and forget it is open), when you close your main session (with all the pinned tabs) and find the single open blank tab session - if you close that window the next time you open Firefox it does not open all your saved tabs and you don't have the option to "restore previous session" with all the tabs because it remembers the blank window session.

title: SSL_ERROR_UNKNOWN_CA_ALERT, but all CA certificates are be installed already and exceptions don't work
content:
I am on Linux Mint, Firefox 100.0 and I am trying to access a website, https://www.citapreviadnie.es:38188 (requires personal DNIe certificate). However, I keep getting SSL_ERROR_UNKNOWN_CA_ALERT. If I view the certificate of the website,

1. Firefox doesn't tell me which part of the chain is invalid or not trusted (or I don't see it) 2. When I try to download and import each of the CA certificates, I get an alert saying "This certificate is already installed as a certificate authority." 3. If I try to import the whole chain, I get another alert telling me "This is not a certificate authority certificate, so it can’t be imported into the certificate authority list." 4. If I try to add a permanent exception to the site, I see "This site attempts to identify itself with invalid information", but if I click "view certificate" I'm back to step 1, and adding the exception does not have any effect.

What am I supposed to do now?
creator: hello152

title: 32-bit Linux error: "undefined symbol: gdk_screen_get_monitor_scale_factor"
content:
Hi,

I used Firefox ESR on an old version of Puppy Linux (Slackware-based). It worked fine until about the end of November 2021, after which none of the updates worked. The last working version is 78.15.0esr (32-bit).

On any later version, if I run Firefox from a console I get the following error message:

firefox: symbol lookup error: /opt/firefox/libxul.so: undefined symbol: gdk_screen_get_monitor_scale_factor

About the same time this happened, Tor browser (based on Firefox ESR) also stopped working, giving a similar error message.

Could anyone explain to me why this happens and if/how I might be able to fix it?

Thanks.
